definition: luxuriant/buxom/variant of 豐|丰[feng1]/variant of 風|风[feng1]/appearance/charm

sentences.english: The taste is healthy, the vitality is abundant, then the muscle is plentiful, the body is strong.
sentences.chinese: 脾胃健，气血盛，则肌肉丰腴，肢体强劲。

sentences.english: Full-bodied, soft and round, with a long finish.
sentences.chinese: 酒体丰腴，柔和而圆润，回味隽永。

sentences.english: The island was virtually a hammock.
sentences.chinese: 这座岛屿事实上是一块丰腴的土地。

sentences.english: Flows out as the waves of Milky years.
sentences.chinese: 丰腴的波浪流淌成光年，那杳渺的蓝色。

sentences.english: She is chubby but not fat.
sentences.chinese: 她长得丰腴但并不肥胖。

sentences.english: Mo which, heavily fine, the head start quality.
sentences.chinese: 那一茉丰腴细腻，先声夺人的品质。

sentences.english: In the tradition of a true Burgundian-style Chardonnay, there's an understated power that runs from start to finish.
sentences.chinese: 拥有传统的勃艮第霞多丽的风格，口感饱满丰腴。

sentences.english: Bosom i saw , both full , throat warbling.
sentences.chinese: 我看见了胸脯，两边那么丰腴，喉咙颤抖着。

sentences.english: At that time I was still having <Longing You…> hairstyle.
sentences.chinese: 当时孝全还有些丰腴，我还是《仰望》专辑的发型。

sentences.english: People in Tang Dynasty regarded plumpness as beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 唐朝时的人是以丰腴为美。

definition: Fengman district of Jilin city 吉林市, Jilin province
perfectly round/(fig.) accommodating/considerate/smooth (way of doing things)
Fengrun district of Tangshan city 唐山市[Tang2 shan1 shi4], Hebei
lit. as round as pearls and as smooth as jade (idiom)/fig. elegant and polished (of singing or writing)
slender waist/fig. pretty woman/mortise and tenon joint on a coffin
